item.title: Throne And Liberty: 5 Best Crossbow Builds
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Players in Throne and Liberty can switch between two weapons to determine their class, each with unique playstyles and masteries.
  • The Battleweaver, Scout, Raider, Outrider, and Scorpion are different builds involving the Crossbow paired with various weapons.
  • Optimal builds like the Scorpion offer high damage output but require high mastery and skill to utilize effectively.

Throne and Liberty offers players the option of having two weapons they can swap between. This will in turn decide the name of the class they have. Each of these classes will play differently but will acquire a wide range of different specializations and masteries to make them better at these weapons.

Players who are putting all of their time into bolstering the mastery and specialization of the Crossbow might wonder what their other choice of weapon should be to ensure they have the best build for their playstyle — and for the various game modes offered.

1 Battleweaver

Crossbow + Staff

  • Primary Stats : Wisdom & Dexterity
  • Difficulty to master: Medium

When a player pairs their Crossbow with a Staff they get a Battleweaver. This is a build that will allow players to deal massive damage to both mobs in an area of effect, but also channel all their attention into a single boss. This makes it a great choice for players who want to deal decent damage all the time.

This can be a rather mana-hungry build, so players will want to be mindful of just how fast they are burning through their reserves. This is also one of the two least-used builds offered to Crossbow enthusiasts. Since there are only seven weapons in the game, this means there are a total of six possible Crossbow builds — the build that did not make the list is Fury.

2 Scout

Crossbow + Longbow

  • Primary Stats : Dexterity & Perception
  • Difficulty to master: Easy

Scouts are a great option for dealing continuous amounts of damage. They also provide players with a new way to play the game that few other builds can offer — this comes in the form of an artillery playstyle. This means they find an enemy and relentlessly rain down massive damage from their chosen point.

Moving means downtime; they are not dealing damage, so having allies to attract all the aggro and cover them will mean they can focus on providing optimal damage output. Players will not be able to take much damage, and not be able to escape, so players will need to be mindful of what else their allies are doing.

3 Raider

Crossbow + Sword and Shield

  • Primary Stats : Strength
  • Difficulty to master: Easy

The Raider is a long-range DPS tank and will be great for new players with how easy it is to play. This build can deal out a high amount of damage to a single target, but also to all targets within an area of effect. This makes it great for clearing dungeons as it can dispatch mobs and bosses alike.

This build puts more focus on its damage output than its survivability, so even though it is a tank, it is far from the most tanky of tanks. Players can survive being targeted while providing long-range DPS long enough that their Support teammates can patch them back up to win fights.

4 Outrider

Crossbow + Greatsword

  • Primary Stats : Dexterity + Perception
  • Difficulty to master: Medium

In terms of difficulty, this build is somewhere between easy and medium. While its playstyle is simple and highly effective, it will take time to get used to the limited survivability offered. A worthwhile Greatswords passive skill to help make them less glassy is Robust Constitution , which will ramp up a player's max health and their health regeneration to keep them around long enough to push damage.

Outriders can deal out a strong flow of consistent damage when in a group that can keep them safe, but if they are not in such a group, they can deal out massive amounts of burst damage before ducking back to safety. Players will find this build works well in PvE, PvP, and GvG game modes, but each of which requires playing it differently. This can make it a challenging build to get a feel for.

5 Scorpion

Crossbow + Daggers

  • Primary Stats : Dexterity & Perception
  • Difficulty to master: High

Scorpion is easily the king of DPS builds. This build makes use of all the tools available to Crossbows and pairs them incredibly well with those available to Daggers. Daggers will not only push this build to new damage heights with its focus on critical hit optimization but also grant it massive mobility to get out of any tricky situation.

Players will be able to deal out massive amounts of continuous damage to both single targets and groups within an area of effect that can make it one of the fastest ways to clear any of the game’s dungeons and be an incredible force of DPS in any game mode. Such an incredible build does come with a drawback, in that this is a very hard build to master. Most players will be able to perform better in the game with other builds purely because of how demanding a Scorpion can be.

item.title: 33 Fastest Cars In Grand Theft Auto 5, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Driving fast cars in GTA 5 is essential for progression and can help players win game modes and complete missions.
  • Developer Rockstar Games has done an impeccable job of creating fast, luxurious vehicles like the Albany Alpha and Dewbauchee Massacro.
  • Acquiring the fastest cars in GTA 5 , like the Progen T20 and Overflod Entity XXR, can enhance the driving gameplay experience.

Grand Theft Auto 5 , a game about stealing cars, is the ultimate open-world action-adventure game. Whether players are single-player devotees or GTA Online buffs, driving cars is vital for progression. Developer Rockstar Games has done an impeccable job of ripping off the world's most luxurious vehicles. Those cheesy names such as Speedophile and Infernus have admittedly grown on players. Speed is a factor as it can help players win game modes, complete missions, and reach the various destinations of Los Santos quickly.

Of course, to reach these high speeds in the first place, players need to have in-depth knowledge of which cars in Grand Theft Auto 5 can help them zoom around the map without a care in the world. There are many vehicles that players can steal and use in Los Santos, but there are only a few ones that can zip around the urban landscape in a definitive fashion. The fastest cars in GTA 5 are a joy to drive around in and should be obtained by fans as soon as possible to make the driving gameplay more engaging than ever.

Updated on October 22, 2024, by Ritwik Mitra: It would be impossible to talk about Grand Theft Auto 5 without mentioning the amazing open world and how many options players have access to when it comes to traversing this landscape. With the fastest cars in GTA 5, moving from point A to point B is a breeze, regardless of whether players are traversing the countryside or exploring urban areas. Sure, there's something to be said about players taking their time to enjoy the sheer amount of detail Rockstar has crammed into this world, but nothing comes close to the adrenaline rush one experiences when reaching breakneck speeds in no time.

33 Albany Alpha

Based On The Cadillac Sixteen & 2013 Cadillac ATS

  • Top Speed: 117.75 mph
  • How to Get: Can only be found or stolen in Los Santos, Rockford Hills, and Vespucci Beach

Given the sheer number of flashy vehicles present in Grand Theft Auto 5 , it's easy to see why most players may find it easy to overlook the Albany Alpha. It's far from the best-looking car in the game and doesn't look all that swift. However, all players need to do is step behind the wheel of this car once to see just how much of a speed demon this vehicle is.

In the right hands, the Albany Alpha is a beast of a vehicle that players can stick with for the long haul if they wish. If players still find the car's exterior to be pretty boring, then they can always drive to Los Santos Customs and deck it out with all the visual upgrades they want.

32 Dinka Jester

Based On The Acura NSX Concept & McLaren MP4-12C

  • Top Speed: 118.75 mph
  • How to Get: Can only be found or stolen in regular traffic

The Dinka Jester is one of the most common cars that players can find in the affluent neighborhoods of Los Santos. Given how easy this car is to find, most people may think that the Jester isn't all that special and can easily be replaced by other vehicles. However, all of this changes once players get to drive around the vehicle and marvel at its amazing speed.

The Jester drives like a dream and can hit extremely high speeds in a flash, making it one of the fastest cars in GTA 5 that players can use to zoom through detailed urban environments and beautiful countryside. It's one of the most underrated vehicles in the game that deserves its time in the spotlight.

31 Dewbauchee JB 700

Based On The Aston Martin DB5

  • Top Speed: 119.25 mph
  • How to Get: Purchasable from Legendary Motorsport from $475,000

Grand Theft Auto 5 loves its parodies and inspirations, which is why it's easy to see the similarities between the Dewbauchee JB 700 and the Aston Martin DB5 are so prominent. The real-life vehicle has become iconic courtesy of its appearances in the James Bond films, and this is alluded to in the description of this vehicle as well.

Fans can't help but laugh as they witness Rockstar's trademark sarcasm on display here, talking about how this vehicle is a favorite of misogynistic spies who love their martinis. All jokes aside, the JB 700 (another note to James Bond) drives like a dream, and players can reach high speeds in no time with one of the fastest cars in GTA 5 .

30 Karin Futo

Based On The Toyota AE86 Levin

  • Top Speed: 119.25 mph
  • How to Get: Can only be found or stolen near Rockford Hills, Los Santos International Airport, and Port of Los Santos

Fans of Initial D who loved the AE86 and how it added a ton of flavor to the touge racing on display in the show will be glad to know that a car inspired by the same design can be found in Grand Theft Auto 5 . The Karin Futo handles like a dream and is capable of reaching blisteringly fast speeds once players put their foot on the gas.

Players who want to turn corners in style and pick up speed quickly will love what the Futo brings to the table. For a vehicle with such impressive handling, it's nice to see that the Karin Futo is also one of the fastest cars in GTA 5 that players can use to run away from cops or win races in style.

29 Pfister Comet

Based On The Porsche 911

  • Top Speed: 119.50 mph
  • How to Get: Purchasable for $85,000 or found near Pacific Bluffs, Rockford Hills, or the Los Santos Customs in Burton

The Porsche 911 is one of the most stylish vehicles and an absolute classic. It's easy to see why players would love the idea of driving around one of the fastest cars in GTA 5 that is inspired by this vehicle, and the Pfizer Comet more than fits the bill in this department.

The style of every sports car in Grand Theft Auto 5 is in a class of its own, and the Comet is no exception here. Its sleek look makes it a fun car to drive around, making every high-speed pursuit a joy to experience.

28 Grotti Carbonizzare

Based On The Nissan GT-R & Ferrari 458 Italia

  • Top Speed: 119.50 mph
  • How to Get: Can only be found or stolen near the Observatory, Marlowe Drive, and Rockford Hills

Some luxury cars look the part and boast some great performance too, making it clear why vehicles like the Grotti Carbonizzare are coveted by so many fans in Grand Theft Auto 5 . It looks sleek and worth adding to a player's garage if players manage to get their hands on this vehicle in some of the posher areas of the game.

In terms of speed, the Grotti Carbonizzare is no slouch. It's one of the fastest cars in GTA 5 that players can use to explore the massive game world in style. Grand Theft Auto 5 may boast the biggest world in the entire series, but players who keep the Grotti Carbonizzare at high speeds as they go from one end of the map to another won't be able to digest the scale of the map because of how ridiculously high this car's speed is.

27 Dewbauchee Rapid GT Cabrio

Based On The Aston Martin Vantage Roadster

  • Top Speed: 119.50 mph
  • How to Get: Can only be found or stolen in Rockford Hills, Vinewood Hills, Paleto Bay, and The Gentry Manor Hotel

Players who want to know what it feels like to drive a luxury Aston Martin vehicle in Grand Theft Auto 5 can check out the Dewbauchee Rapid GT Cabrio for themselves. It's a fun, fast car to drive that handles well.

While it may not be the speeding demon that most fans would prefer to drive, the Rapid GT Cabrio more than makes up for it with its responsiveness. It takes real skill to drive at top speeds on roads without crashing, and this vehicle's handling makes the task a lot easier to handle.

26 Pegassi Vacca

Based On The Lamborghini Gallardo

  • Top Speed: 120.25 mph
  • How to Get: Purchasable for $240,000 in Legendary Motorsport and Southern San Andreas Super Autos

A car that looks amazing, it's easy to see why so many people would love to drive around in the Pegassi Vacca. Its look is reminiscent of the Lamborghini Gallardo, which is one of the most popular luxury sports cars around for a reason. The look of this car is iconic and inspired the look of the Vacca, which is a blast to drive at high speeds.

Controlling this car can be a challenge, but most players will quickly get the hang of things as driving around in this supercar becomes second nature to them. The speed this car can reach when everything is upgraded to the max is so high that most people will find themselves unable to resist the thrill of revving the throttle up to the max every time they sit in this car.

25 Grotti Cheetah

Based On The Ferrari Enzo & Koenigsegg Agera

  • Top Speed: 120.25 mph
  • How to Get: Purchasable for $650,000 in Legendary Motorsport

The Cheetah is a car that Grand Theft Auto veterans are pretty familiar with. Sure, the car looks very different from its iteration in the 3D Universe, but that doesn't take away anything from its amazing look and the impressively high speeds this car can reach. The fact that this car is based on the Ferrari Enzo is something that fans of the legendary car company will love.

There's no denying that the Grotti Cheetah costs a pretty penny, but most people would attest to the fact that this investment is completely worth it. The sheer joy players can experience from zooming around this car at fast speeds is something that needs to be experienced firsthand by players to understand why acquiring the Cheetah is such a major achievement for speed demons in Grand Theft Auto 5 .

24 Benefactor Surano

Based On The Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster

  • Top Speed: 121.00 mph
  • How to Get: Purchasable for $99,000 in Southern San Andreas Super Autos

For a car that's nowhere near as expensive as some of the other high-speed vehicles in the game, most people will be surprised by what the Benefactor Surano brings to the table. It looks like a humble sports car, but it's only when players upgrade this vehicle to the max that they realize just how much hidden untapped potential this car has.

The Benefactor Surano can reach immense speeds in no time and let players enjoy what a high-speed vehicle in Grand Theft Auto 5 can achieve as long as players don't step on the accelerator in places with high traffic or tight turns. The car may not be the priciest vehicle around, but this doesn't mean that players should just total the vehicle without a care in the world.

23 Lampadati Pigalle

A Deceptively Swift Vehicle

  • Top Speed: 121.25 mph
  • How to Get: Can only be found or stolen in Burton and Alta

At a glance, the Lampadati Pigalle doesn't look like a fast car at all. The car looks like a pretty regular vehicle and won't blow anyone's mind when they gaze upon this vehicle. However, players will be singing an entirely different tune when they end up driving this vehicle around.

The car is very fast and can take players for a pretty wild ride indeed. It may not be a looker, but the sheer speed that the Lampadati Pigalle can achieve makes it a vehicle worth checking out for speed junkies who love driving around the world of Grand Theft Auto 5 at the fastest speeds possible.

22 Overflod Entity XF

As Fast As They Come

  • Top Speed: 121.50 mph
  • How to Get: Purchased for $795,000 from Legendary Motorsport

It's only a given that any car based on the models by Koenigsegg and Lamborghini would be blindingly fast, and such is the case with the Overflod Entity XF. This vehicle is an excellent high-speed car that can blast through streets in no time flat... although the crash is going to be just as spectacular if players lose control of their vehicle.

Players need to complete the mission I Fought the Law... to get access to this vehicle, which costs $795,000. This may be a pricey purchase, but most players won't mind since the sheer level of speed unlocked after purchasing this vehicle more than makes up for any second thoughts players may experience after its purchase.

21 Grotti Turismo R

Certainly Looks As Fast As It Drives

  • Top Speed: 121.75 mph
  • How to Get: Purchased for $500,000 from Legendary Motorsport

The 1.11 Business update for Grand Theft Auto 5 brought with it several changes, including new cars that players could mess around with. One of these vehicles is the Grotti Turismo R, which is certainly one of the coolest-looking cars that players can get in Grand Theft Auto 5 .

This hybrid-electric car can reach blindingly fast speeds in record time, making it one of the more fun vehicles to mess around with in the game. It can be bought for $500,000, which is surprisingly decent given how pricey some of the fastest vehicles in GTA 5 are. Given how cool this car looks, players won't be getting tired of driving the Turismo R around for quite some time.

20 Progen T20

Looks The Part And Drives Like It Too

  • Top Speed: 122.25 mph
  • How to Get: Purchased for $2,200,000 from Legendary Motorsport

The Progen series of supercars are some of the fastest vehicles in the entire game. This applies to the Progen T20 as well. This car wastes no time in letting players know that they're in for a wild ride indeed.

While it costs a pricey $2.2 million, anyone who purchases the Progen T20 knows that they're getting a massive return on their investment. In the grand scheme of things, it's a small price to pay for the massive speeds players can reach. The incredible look of this car itself more than justified the price players have to pay, especially with money becoming a resource that players don't have to worry about after a point.

19 Pegassi Osiris

Turns Into A Blur At Top Speeds

  • Top Speed: 122.00 mph
  • How to Get: Purchased for $1,950,000 from Legendary Motorsport

Speaking of cars with amazing top speeds, it would be hard to not mention the Pegassi Osiris. The car looks brilliant, with its speed being the stuff of legends.

Anyone who manages to get their hands on the Pegassi Osiris will have an amazing time with this vehicle indeed. It costs just shy of $2 million, so players should start saving up if they want to enjoy the benefits of driving such an amazing car.

18 Pegassi Monroe

A Really Fun Car To Drive

  • Top Speed: 122.00 mph
  • How to Get: Purchased for $490,000 from Legendary Motorsport

The Pegassi series is full to the brim with some of the fastest and most enjoyable cars in the entire game. The Pegassi Monroe certainly fits this description to a T.

Given the millions and millions that players have seen for the cars till now, it's great that the Pegassi Monroe is relatively cheap at around $490,000. Players who want to get their hands on an affordable supercar should look no further than the Monroe.

17 Dewbauchee Massacro

A Sports Car In Every Sense Of The Word

  • Top Speed: 121.75 mph
  • How to Get: Can be found in Los Santos Customs in Burton, LSIA, La Mesa

A sports car that looks the part, players who get their hands on the Dewbauchee Massacro should count their stars for how lucky they are. After all, it can't be bought anywhere in the game.

Instead, players need to get lucky that it spawns in the game world so that they can take it out for a ride. It's a great car that is ridiculously underrated due to its scarcity.

16 Vapid Pißwasser Dominator

Blows Its Opposition Out Of The Water

  • Top Speed: 126.50 mph
  • How to Get: Win the 3rd Stock Car Race

The Vapid Pißwasser Dominator is one of the fastest cars in GTA 5 . The fact that it's a muscle car makes this achievement even more impressive.

Players need to engage in the Stock Car Racing activity and beat the third race to unlock this powerful vehicle. Zooming through the streets of the game becomes a blast with this amazing car.

15 Lampadati Felon

A Speedy Four-Door Coupe For Missions

  • Top Speed: 113.75 mph
  • How to Get: Purchased for $100,000 from Southern San Andreas Super Autos

It's always a bit of a buzzkill when playing through the missions, and players are forced to find a four-door sedan to carry the rest of the heist crew. Thankfully, there are options like the Lampadati Felon available for players to still carry passengers while outracing most vehicles on the street.

While the Felon coupe may not look as flashy as some other fast and expensive cars in GTA , it was designed by a racing car company and can reach a top speed of over 118 MPH. It will get players and their crews out of trouble in no time.

14 Bravado Gauntlet

The Fastest Muscle Cars In The Game

  • Top Speed: 113.25 mph
  • How to Get: Purchased for $32,000 from Southern San Andreas Super Autos

While most races are dominated by hyper and super-class vehicles, there are a few muscle cars in Grand Theft Auto 5 for fans of American power that can compete with a few of the speedier cars. The Bravado Gauntlet is one such vehicle.

The supercharged V8 engine and Charger-inspired streamlined body make the Gauntlet an impressively fast vehicle. The Gauntlet was given a powerfully fast Hellfire upgrade in The Diamond Casino And Resort update that further elevates it above the other muscle cars in GTA .

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Releases Update 2.6 'Annals of Pinecany's Mappou Age'
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Honkai: Star Rail's 2.6 update introduces new characters like Rappa and events with valuable rewards.
  • Fans can expect permanent new areas, limited-time events, and Light Cones.
  • The update includes a new gameplay mode, enemies, and optimization improvements, building anticipation for Version 2.7.

Honkai: Star Rail has released its 2.6 update titled "Annals of Pinecany's Mappou Age" and players can participate in its limited-time events for a free Light Cone, Stellar Jades, and more plentiful rewards. In Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.6, fans travel back to Penacony for a new adventure with some familiar faces and new characters.

In a previous trailer for Honkai: Star Rail 's 2.6 update, fans caught a glimpse of the Trailblazer's next mission, which sees the Astral Express crew becoming students in Penacony. The trailer also revealed the in-game debut of some new characters, including the playable 5-star Rappa and the long-rumored Mr. Reca. Now, the wait is finally over as the patch has rolled out on October 23. Aside from these new additions, the update will feature three limited-time events with rewards, and HoYoverse has confirmed each of their dates and durations.

As confirmed in an official HoYoLab blog entry, Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.6 brings the sixth Trailblaze Continuance mission "Penacony - Banana Outrage: Battles Without Ninja and Humanity," set in a new area called Penacony Paperfold University College. The quest will be permanently available after the 2.6 update and players can unlock it after reaching Trailblaze Level 21. The update also debuts Rappa, a 5-star Imaginary unit following the path of Erudition. Her signature 5-star Light Cone is called "Ninjutsu Inscription: Dazzling Evilbreaker." Rappa is featured in Honkai: Star Rail 's current banners, along with Dan Heng: Imbibitor Lunae. Version 2.6 introduces two new 4-star Light Cones: "Dream's Montage (Abundance)" and "Ninja Record: Sound Hunt (Destruction)." The latter can be obtained for free by participating in the "Sound Hunt Ninjutsu Inscription" event.

All events will grant plenty of Stellar Jades, XP materials, and other items useful for combat. Honkai: Star Rail 2.6 also debuts the third Simulated Universe DLC named "Unknowable Domain." This permanent gameplay mode gives players Stellar Jades, Star Rail Passes, and other items upon completion. It is unlocked by clearing World 5 from the original Simulated Universe. Finally, the update introduces new enemies, such as the boss Wonder Forest's Banacademic Office Staff. Although Version 2.6 has only just launched, fans are already excited about Sunday's release during Honkai: Star Rail 2.7 and several leaks of his kit have surfaced within the community, too.

While Rappa has become playable in the Honkai: Star Rail 2.6 update, and both Sunday and Fugue are also on their way, HoYoverse has not confirmed that Mr. Reca will join the roster. Even though Mr. Reca stars in the newest Trailblaze Continuance and features in two 4-star Light Cones, it seems he won't become playable in the foreseeable future. On the other hand, some Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.7 leaks suggest that players will get a free 4-star character of their choice.

Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.6 Patch Notes

New Story

  • Trailblaze Continuance "Penacony — Banana Outrage: Battles Without Ninja and Humanity"

Laughter, song, and dance linger all day, and by twilight, we sleep and do not wake — this dream world is like an old banana peel, covered in dark stains, how intolerable! Seek the true path, and extinguish this Mappou Age of the Dharma!

Availability: Permanently available after the Version 2.6 update

Requirement: Trailblaze Level ≥ 21

※ During Version 2.6, this content can be experienced in advance through the Finality's Vision function.

※ Trailblazers are recommended to experience this content after completing the Trailblaze Mission "Penacony — Stranger in a Strange Land."

New Characters

  • 5-Star character Rappa (Erudition: Imaginary)

Rappa is a DMG dealing character suited for attacking multiple targets. After using her Ultimate, Rappa will gain an extra turn and an ability that can reduce Toughness regardless of weakness. Additionally, Rappa can increase the Break DMG sustained by Broken enemies.

New Light Cones

  • 5-Star "Ninjutsu Inscription: Dazzling Evilbreaker (Erudition)"

Obtainable through the "Brilliant Fixation" Light Cone Event Warp.

  • 4-Star "Dream's Montage (Abundance)"

Obtainable through the "Brilliant Fixation" Light Cone Event Warp.

  • 4-star Light Cone "Ninja Record: Sound Hunt (Destruction)"

Obtainable through the "Sound Hunt Ninjutsu Inscription" event.

New Areas

  • Penacony Paperfold University College

Penacony's famous college, located in the Moment of Sol. The cradle of outstanding talents that continuously sends the light and heat of knowledge within and outside the Dreamscape.

New Events

  • Sound Hunt Ninjutsu Inscription

The grand music festival hides a lurking threat as the Dazzling Ninja Hero takes the stage — let the hunt begin once more! The band performance will soon commence, and it promises to be an electrifying spectacle!

Event Period: 2024/10/25 12:00:00 – 2024/12/02 03:59:00 (server time)

Requirement: Trailblaze Level ≥ 21

※ This content can be experienced in advance through the Finality's Vision function.

※ Trailblazers are recommended to experience this content after completing the Trailblaze Continuance "Penacony — Battles Without Ninja and Humanity."

  • Mr. Cold Feet's Pop-Up Shop

Sampo seems to be preparing for some new business venture in Belobog. Rather suspicious. But... what if you could get something out of this?

Event Period: 2024/10/31 12:00:00 – 2024/11/11 03:59:00 (server time)

Requirement: Trailblaze Level ≥ 21

※ This content can be experienced in advance through the Finality's Vision function.

※ Trailblazers are recommended to experience this content after completing the Trailblaze Mission "Jarilo-VI — Silent Galaxy"

  • Shadow of the Ranger

What new project have the researchers aboard the space station accepted this time? All clues are clouded in uncertainty and confusion and an enigma encircles the figure of a Galaxy Ranger, yet you seem to be the only one in the know...

Event Period: 2024/11/13 04:00:00 – 2024/12/02 03:59:00 (server time)

Requirement: Trailblaze Level ≥ 21

※ This content can be experienced in advance through the Finality's Vision function.

※ Trailblazers are recommended to experience this content after completing the Trailblaze Continuance "Penacony — Battles Without Ninja and Humanity."

  • Gift of Odyssey

Log in every day during the event to obtain check-in rewards. Trailblazers can claim Star Rail Special Pass ×10 after checking in for 7 days!

※ Please refer to future announcements for information on other events.

New Gameplay

  • Simulated Universe: Unknowable Domain

Herta and the others have added another extrapolation branch to the expansion module in the form of an unknowable domain. Scholars, geniuses, and Rupert II's legacy will draw all into a maelstrom...

Availability: After the Version 2.6 update

Unlock Conditions: Clear Simulated Universe: World 5

Others

  • Enemies

Banacademic Office's Assistanana, Banacademic Office's Fortune BananAdvisor, Banacademic Office's Dreamweaver BananAdvisor, Banacademic Office's Charmony BananAdvisor, Wonder Forest's Banacademic Office Staff, Cacophonic Conductor

  • Gameplay Updates

Treasures Lightward: Regular game modes Apocalyptic Shadow, Pure Fiction, and Forgotten Hall: Memory of Chaos will be refreshed alternatively. For more details, see below:

Apocalyptic Shadow: Sovereign Control

2024/10/28 04:00:00 – 2024/12/09 03:59:00 (server time)

When an enemy with Steadfast Safeguard is Weakness Broken, recover Skill Points for all ally characters and activate their Ultimates.

Increases the Weakness Break DMG received by all enemies by 20% and Follow-up ATK DMG received by 20%.

Pure Fiction: Rumor Mill

2024/11/11 04:00:00 – 2024/12/23 03:59:00 (server time)

Increases DoT taken by enemy targets by 35%. Enemy targets that receive DoT have their DMG dealt reduced by 35%. After they are attacked, their action is Advanced Forward by 35%.

Memory of Chaos: Dancing with the Dreams

2024/11/25 04:00:00 – 2025/01/06 03:59:00 (server time)

When enemy targets are Weakness Broken, adds 1 hit to Memory Turbulence's Hits Per Action. If the target is an Elite enemy or higher, then additionally adds 1 hit, stacking up to 15 hits.

At the start of every Cycle, every Memory Turbulence hit will deal a set amount of DMG to a random enemy target 1 time without resetting Hits Per Action.

  • Stage

Stagnant Shadow: Shape of Timbre

Cavern of Corrosion: Path of Uncertainty

  • Relics

Cavern Relic "Sacerdos' Relived Ordeal"

Cavern Relic "Scholar Lost in Erudition"

  • System

The Relic Switch interface now has an added option to view the Relic acquisition methods. Additionally, the Relic acquisition interface now includes a direct access button to "Relic Synthesis."

After obtaining a new avatar, a red dot notification will appear in "Phone — Avatar" segment.

  • Others

Adds new content such as some readable items, data bank entries, Achievements, loading screen texts, and Disks.

Some photos have been added to the photo wall in March 7th's room. Trailblazers can check it out after completing the corresponding Trailblaze Missions.

Adds new Light Cones "Before the Tutorial Mission Starts (Nihility)," "Hey, Over Here (Abundance)," and "For Tomorrow's Journey (Harmony)" and their corresponding Superimposition materials to the Herta's Store.

Adds a new button to view max-level Traces when previewing character details on the Warp and Aptitude Showcase event pages.

Certain iOS devices can now select the 120 framerate option in Setttings>Graphics Settings>FPS option.

Adjustments and Optimizations

  • Characters and Enemies

Adjusts the order of the recommended upgrade for the character "Firefly (Destruction: Fire)"'s Traces.

Adjusts the ability effects of some enemies in the stealth state. If attacked by these enemy targets in the stealth state, the enemy targets will not hide their own Weakness after entering battle.

Optimizes the brief text description of some characters' abilities. This optimization does not affect the actual effect of the ability.

  • Combat

Adjusts the visual effects of certain ability effects and map effects.

  • System

Optimizes the default scheme names when building a new Filter Scheme.

Optimizes the order of the main stats in the Relic Filter Scheme interface.

Optimizes the Relic filtering, specifically of the head and hands slots' have been optimized to non-essential options.

  • Audio

Adjusts the expression of the term "Flamewheel Forge" in some dialogue voice lines during the Companion Mission "Swords to Plowshares" when the voice language is set to English.

Optimizes some dialogue voice lines during the mission flow of Trailblaze Continuance "The Xianzhou Luofu — Inquisition to Rectitude," "The Quieting of Quillons," and "By Words of Many" when the voice language is set to English.

Adjusts some dialogue voice lines during the mission flow of Trailblaze Mission "Jarilo-VI — To Rot or to Burn" when the voice language is set to English.

Optimizes certain Japanese voice lines for the character "Jiaoqiu (Nihility: Fire)" in the Trailblaze Continuance "Xianzhou Luofu — Finest Duel Under the Pristine Blue."

Adjusts some dialogue voice lines for the NPC Yunli during her visit to the Astral Express when the voice language is set to Japanese.

Adjusts some dialogue voice lines during the mission flow of the Adventure Mission "Pallbearing Merchant, Swordwielding Recruit" when the voice language is set to Japanese.

Adjusts some dialogue voice lines during the mission flow of Trailblaze Continuance "The Xianzhou Luofu — A Fugue From Beyond" when the voice language is set to Japanese.

Optimizes some dialogue voice lines during the mission flow of Trailblaze Continuance "The Xianzhou Luofu — Last Stand of a Lone Wolf" when the voice language is set to Japanese.

Adjusts some dialogue voice lines with the NPC Chunfen in the Central Starskiff Haven map when the voice language is set to Japanese.

Optimizes some dialogue voice lines with the NPC Mada in The Skysplitter map when the voice language is set to Korean.

  • Others

Adjusts the startup logic of the PC client, and after the modification, it will no longer be possible to open multiple instances of the Honkai: Star Rail client simultaneously.

Bug Fixes

  • Characters and Enemies

Fixes an issue where, under certain circumstances, some special effects of the character "Jiaoqiu (Nihility: Fire)" Skill would display abnormally.

Fixes the inconsistency between Action Order and the ability description under certain circumstances when the character "Yunli (Destruction: Physical)" uses her "Intuit: Slash" ability. The ability will match the description after the fix.

Fixes the issue where part of "Ruan Mei (Harmony: Ice)"'s Technique effect didn't trigger correctly in battle under certain circumstances.

Fixes the issue where the effect description for the character "March 7th (The Hunt: Imaginary)" appeared abnormally in certain interfaces. This issue does not affect the actual effect of the skill.

Fixes the issue where, after enabling brief descriptions, the ultimate skill of the character "Boothill (The Hunt: Physical)" lacked a detailed explanation of the "action delay" effect.

Fixes the issue where, under certain circumstances, some characters' ability effects' duration is reduced abnormally.

Fixes issues with certain character models, visual effects, and movement animations.

Fixes the issue where, under certain circumstances, after the enemy unit "Memory Zone Meme 'Something In The Mirror'" transformed into other enemy units, its Toughness is reduced abnormally.

  • Combat

Fixes the issue where there is a chance for the target selected by the character "Feixiao (The Hunt: Wind)"'s and "March 7th (The Hunt: Imaginary)"'s Follow-up ATK to be incorrect when fighting in specific team lineups.

Fixes an issue where, under certain circumstances, the probability indicator for the character "Dr. Ratio (The Hunt: Imaginary)" performing a Follow-up ATK against enemies displayed abnormally.

Fixes an issue where, under certain conditions, the game would display a black screen after a battle using a support character.

Fixes an issue where, during battle with the enemy "'Harmonious Choir' The Great Septimus," the Shield "Walk in the Light" on the character Moze (The Hunt: Lightning) could display an incorrect remaining shield value in the Real-Time Combat View interface after the shield was depleted. This issue did not affect the actual shield effect.

Fixes an issue where certain camera effects appeared abnormal during battles with the enemy "Harmonious Choir 'The Great Septimus.'"

  • Missions

Fixes an issue in Trailblaze Continuance "The Xianzhou Luofu" - "Finest Duel Under the Pristine Blue: Part I," where moving to a specific location from Yunli's POV could cause the mission flow to become unprogressable.

Fixes an issue during the Adventure Mission "Winter Soldiers' March" where, under certain conditions, using a character's Technique to attack enemies and enter battle could potentially cause abnormal game progression.

  • Gameplay

Fixes an issue in the game mode "Apocalyptic Shadow" where imbuing a Weakness Type to enemy targets could occasionally result in abnormal effects.

Fixes an issue where, under specific operations, obtaining the Curio "Rubert Empire Difference Machine" and other certain Curios through the Occurrence "Flea Market" could occasionally result in abnormal game progression.

Fixes an issue where certain operations caused the Simulated Universe main interface to behave abnormally.

Fixes an issue in the Divergent Universe where the Equations "Mausoleum of Scars" and "City Restorer" did not count as attacks when dealing damage.

Fixes an issue where certain stages could accumulate more than 40,000 points in the Pure Fiction game mode.

Fixes an issue in the gameplay "Luminary Wardance" where certain storyline combat flows could behave abnormally under specific circumstances.

  • Environment Visuals

Fixes the issue where, under certain circumstances, the enemy unit Warp Trotter would disappear abnormally in the Scalegorge Waterscape map.

  • System

Fixes an issue where selecting a Friend's "Trailblazer" character as a support character to join the team could result in the character name displaying incorrectly in the Real-Time Combat View interface.

Fixes an issue on certain mobile devices where clicking/pressing/tapping on specific blank areas of the Team Lineup interface would cause the interface to close unexpectedly.

Fixes an issue when playing on PS5® where, under certain circumstances, the feature that causes models to gradually fade while shifting perspective would not function correctly.

  • Audio

Fixes certain incorrect English dialogue voice lines during the Trailblaze Continuance "The Xianzhou Luofu" — "By Words of Many."

Fixes an issue where some English voice lines are abnormal for "Saga of Primaveral Blade" gameplay mode.

Fixes an issue where some dialogue voice lines are abnormal during the mission flow of Trailblaze Continuance "The Xianzhou Luofu — A Fugue From Beyond" when the voice language is set to Korean.

  • Others

Fixes an issue where, when the quantity of certain relics, items, or materials in the inventory reached or exceeded the limit, there was a chance that some stages could not be accessed.

In-game texts for the 13 languages have been adjusted, optimized, and fixed. These changes do not affect the actual effects. Trailblazers can switch the game language through "Phone — Settings — Language" and view the corresponding changes in the announcement.

Fixes and optimizations in English include the following (they have no impact on the actual in-game effects):

Optimizes the ability descriptions for the character "Feixiao (The Hunt: Wind)"'s Skill and Talent, "Fu Xuan (Preservation: Quantum)"'s Skill, "Dr. Ratio (The Hunt: Imaginary)"'s Ultimate, and "Yanqing (The Hunt: Ice)"'s and "Bailu (Abundance: Lightning)"'s Talents, as well as the brief ability descriptions for "Jade (Erudition: Quantum)"'s Skill, "Dr. Ratio (The Hunt: Imaginary)"'s and "Robin (Harmony: Physical)"'s Ultimates, "Herta (Erudition: Ice)"'s Talent, and "Feixiao (The Hunt: Wind)"'s Technique.

Optimizes the effect descriptions for the character "Feixiao (The Hunt: Wind)" Eidolon 4 and "Lingsha (Abundance: Fire)" Eidolon 6.

Optimizes the Light Cone ability description for the Light Cone "I Shall Be My Own Sword (Destruction)."

Optimizes certain character voice over subtitle text for "Huohuo (Abundance: Wind)."

Optimizes the descriptions to achieve the "Time to Hunt" Achievement.

Adjusted the style of expressions related to "Follow-up ATK," "teammates," "this unit," "all allies," "ally target," "ally character," and "Additional DMG."

Adjusts and optimizes various texts, including storyline dialogues, item descriptions, readable items, gameplay texts, entries in the data bank, Relic sources, tutorials, system prompts, Simulated Universe Blessings, and status effect descriptions.

item.title: The Sims 4: Wants and Fears Guide
item.description:
There are various features in The Sims 4 that help the game feel more realistic and immersive - Wants and Fears are a perfectly example of this. A Sim's environment and personality will direct affect how they feel, and this will be expressed not only through moodlets but also through Wants and Fears.

The Wants and Fears system is very different from the one available in The Sims 2 , and this guide aims to explain exactly how it works so gamers can familiarize themselves with this challenging yet fun gameplay feature.

How to Enable Wants and Fears in The Sims 4

In The Sims 4 , players can toggle Wants and Fears on and off at any time. While Fears can sometimes negatively affect a Sim, Wants are a great way to improve a Sim's mood and collect points, which the player can spend in the Reward Store.

To enable or disable Wants and Fears in The Sims 4 , players must pause the game, select Settings, and then open the Game Options tab . On the right hand side of the Game Options tab, gamers will see a "Show Wants & Fears" option with a box next to it . Players have to check the box if they'd like to play with Wants & Fears activated or they can uncheck it to keep these features hidden.

How to Check and Complete Wants in The Sims 4

To check a Sim's Wants in The Sims 4 , players must hover over the bubbles that appear on the left side of the selected Sim's head in the bottom left corner of the screen. There are lifetime aspirations in The Sims 4 that Sims must work towards throughout their lives, but these bubbles only display the Sim's momentaneous Wants. However, gamers can pin Wants so they don't disappear, ensuring that the Sim will receive their reward no matter how far in the future they complete the Wants .

To complete a Want in The Sims 4 , players will simply have to perform the task connected to the Sim's wishes. Oftentimes, the Want's description will give the player direct instructions on what they have to do to fulfill a Sim's Want.

How to Check and Overcome Fears in The Sims 4

As Sims experience certain events in their lives, they may acquire Fears, which will affect their mood. Thankfully, there are ways to deal with Fears in The Sims 4 and prevent them from haunting Sims throughout their lives.

Here are all of the Fears in The Sims 4 and how to overcome them:

Fear

Cause

Solution

Fear of being cheated on

  • Have the Jealous trait
  • Mediocre WooHoo with partner
  • Lack of attention from a partner
  • Catch a partner romancing others

Discuss Fear of being cheated on with a partner

Fear of death

  • Near-death experiences
  • Death of close relatives or friends

Discuss Fear of Death with other Sims

Fear of fire

  • Experience a fire

Extinguish a fire

Fear of ghosts

  • Have a negative experience with a ghost Sim

Fight a ghost

Fear of the dark

  • Have a negative experience at night

Go outside at night with the Confident moodlet

Fear of swimming

  • Have a negative experience while swimming

Swim for an hour with the Confident moodlet

Fear of failure

  • Perform poorly at work
  • Craft poor quality items

Show off a crafted item or ask for a performance review

Fear of a dead-end job

  • Not receiving a promotion or raise in a while

Use the Regain Passion interaction on the Sim before going to work

Fear of Cowplants

  • Eat a Cowplant's cake

Milk a Cowplant with the Confident moodlet

Fear of being judged

  • Be the target of Mean social interactions

Use the Figure Out Differents interaction on two Sims

Fear of crowded places

  • Visit a crowded lot

Use three Funny social interactions while in a crowded lot

Fear of unfulfilled dreams

  • Not completing Wants in a while

Complete a want and then use the Discuss Fears interaction on another Sim

Fear of failing after-school activity

  • Be a Low Confidence Sim
  • Have the Overachiever trait

Complete the daily task for an after-school activity with a Happy moodlet

Fear of disappointing parents

  • Drop out of high school or university
  • Share negative sentiments with caregiver
  • Low Confidence Sim

Use the Absolve Fears interaction on a deceased caregiver's urn or use the Set Expectations interaction with a living caregiver

Fear of failing classes

  • Be a Low Confidence Sim
  • Have the Overachiever trait
  • Have low grades at school

Do Extra Credit Work on Homework after asking a teacher for it

Fear of failing tests

  • Fail an exam or pass an exam with a low grade

Prepare for exam with the Focused moodlet

Fear of homework

  • Not doing homework in a while

Complete homework two days in a row with the Focused moodlet

Fear of being inferior

  • Be a Low Confidence Sim

Get B or higher grades at school or gain more than five levels in a Skill

Fear of horses

  • Have a negative experience with a horse
  • Have the Paranoid trait

Use the Discuss Fear of Horses interaction with other Sims or have nice interactions with horses

Fear of eviction

  • Receive a fine from the Property Owner

Successfully use three friendly or flirty interactions with the Property Owner

Fear of being alone

  • Have a low relationship meter or bad romantic satisfaction with a partner
  • Have the Lovebug, Unflirty, or Cat Lover trait

Use the Seek Validation interaction on a romantic partner, use the Practice Affirmations interaction on a mirror or seek Couples Counseling using the Cupid's Corner app

Fear of intimacy

  • Have the Socially Awkward, Noncommittal, Unflirty, or Romantically Reserved trait

Use the Discuss Comfort Levels or the Share Intimate Thoughts interactions with a close friend

item.title: All New & Returning Mounts In WoW's 20th Anniversary Celebration
item.description:
Over the past few years, the anniversary celebration for each year of World of Warcraft has gotten more content. What was originally just a pet and a letter in your mailbox has become a full-fledged world event filled with world bosses, loot, and cosmetics. Of course, one of the most popular cosmetics that players will always go for are mounts.

There are plenty of mounts for players to obtain as part of the 20th Anniversary celebration for World of Warcraft . In fact, some mounts that were previously unobtainable after their resptive events were over can now be obtained once again for a limited time. So if you want to add more mounts to your collection, here are all the ones you can get that are part of this milestone event.

Coldflame Tempest

The one mount that will take the most effort, for lack of a better term, would be the Coldflame Tempest mount. This large glowing bird mount is the newest edition in the line of exclusive anniversary mounts. Unlike the other mounts, Coldflame Tempest can only be obtained by completing the special 20th Anniversary meta-achievement known as "A Cool Twenty Years".

This achievement requires you to complete the following achievements related to 20th Anniversary festivities:

Achievement Name

How to Unlock

I Have That One!

Match one mount during Mount Mania. Depending on how many mounts you have, this may take some time to unlock as some of the mounts part of this activity are exceedingly rare.

Pet Mischief

Use a pet disguise to turn into one of your pets and then roam around the celebration area.

Peanut Gallery

React to Lorewalker Cho's stories 50 times. You can typically get around seven to eight opportunities to react, so this achievement just takes time.

A Gatecrasher

Kill one of the world bosses in Tanaris.

Fashion Critic

Vote during the Fashion Frenzy event.

Balloonist

Ride a balloon around the celebration area. Once you are on the balloon, stay on it until the achievement unlocks.

An Original

Kill one of the original world bosses scattered across Kalimdor and the Eastern Kingdoms.

Codex Edition: Ahn'Qiraj

Complete the "Codex of Chromie" scenario.

Azure Worldchiller

Just like with the 19th Anniversary, Azure Worldchiller is a drop off of Doomwalker in Tanaris. It doesn't appear that the drop rate has been reduced, so you should get this mount on your first kill.

Core Hound

The Core Hound was once a reward for clearing the Level 100 version of Molten Core back during the 10th Anniversary. While the Core Hound has occasionally been obtainable via the Black Market Auction House, it can be purchased for 20 Bronze Celebration Tokens during this event.

So if you ever wanted the original Core Hound mount but didn't want to deplete your gold reserves, this is the best time to get it.

If you already have the Core Hound mount, you will not see it listed for sale with Storekeeper Reginald.

Illidari Doomhawk

The Illidari Doomhawk was also once a mount that dropped from Doomwalker back during a previous anniversary event. This year, however, it can be purchased from Historian Ma'di for 5,000 Timewarped Badges.

Obsidian Worldbreaker

This highly coveted miniature Deathwing mount was a reward from the 15th Anniversary event. Like the Core Hound mount, the Obsidian Worldbreaker was occasionally available on the Black Market Auction House. It can be purchased from Storekeeper Reginald for 20 Bronze Celebration Tokens.

There is some information datamined from this patch that suggests that there is a special Burning Legion-themed motorcycle known as Incognitro, the Indecipherable Felcycle that will be a reward from the upcoming Guest Relations that starts later this month. If this ends up getting implemented, this guide will be updated with information on how to get this mount.

New Timewalking Mounts

While they are not technically part of the 20th Anniversary event, there are several new mounts that can be purchased from Timewalking vendors. They came out at the same time as the 20th Anniversary event, and that is why they are being included.

These three mounts are the Frayfeather Hippogryph, the Amani Hunting Bear, and the Enchanted Spellweave Carpet. The mount that will be available will rotate each week. For example, right now the Frayfeather Hippogryph can be purchased now for 5,000 Timewarped Badges. However, when The Burning Crusade Timewalking is active on November 5th, the Amani Hunting Bear will be available for the same price. Then finally, the Enchanted Spellweave Carpet is available during Wrath of the Lich King Timewalking
